articles.title: An AI image of Oakland City Hall is missing some stuff…can you spot it?

Research shows AI is reshaping tasks but leaders can't agree on how far it will go in the workplace. Indeed published a study on common work skills susceptible to AI transformation.

articles.title: AMD shares surge after AI chip deal with OpenAI
articles.author: Sam Boughedda
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices shares have surged 25% in premarket trading after the company announced a multi-year agreement to supply artificial intelligence chips to OpenAI. The agreement reportedly includes an option for OpenAI to acquire up to 10% of the chipmaker's equity. The partnership will see the deployment of hundreds of thousands of AMD's graphics processing units over several years beginning in the second half of 2026. OpenAI plans to construct a one-gigawatt facility using AMD's forthcoming MI450 series chips starting next year.

articles.title: AMD teams up with OpenAI to challenge Nvidia's AI chip dominance
articles.author: Jess Weatherbed
articles.summary: AMD is partnering with OpenAI to provide six gigawatts worth of processors for AI data centers. The five-year agreement aims to help OpenAI bolster its infrastructure to meet growing computational demands for AI applications like ChatGPT. AMD expects the agreement to deliver 'tens of billions of dollars in revenue' for the company.

articles.title: OpenAI, AMD Announce Massive Computing Deal, Marking New Phase Of AI Boom
articles.author: Robbie Whelan
articles.summary: The five-year agreement will challenge Nvidia's market dominance. OpenAI plans deployment of AMD's new MI450 chips in its AI systems.      Â   .   in OpenAI's AI system will be based on AMD's MI450 chip.

articles.title: How Can Companies Preserve Knowledge? Fine-Tuning An AI Model
articles.author: Nataliya Andreychuk
articles.summary: Nataliya Andreychuk is the CEO of Viseven. She is a leading digital transformation evangelist for the pharma and life sciences industries. She explains how to fine-tune an AI model to turn it into an expert that never quits.

articles.title: Agentic AI: The New Battleground For Customer Experience
articles.author: Alan Ranger
articles.summary: Alan Ranger is the VP of Marketing at NiCE Cognigy, a global leader in AI-first customer service automation. According to UiPath research, 77% of enterprises are prepared to invest in agentic AI within the year. The biggest challenge is organizational readiness to deploy it effectively. Partnerships between AI platform providers, cloud vendors, contact center technology companies and system integrators are key to success.

articles.title: OpenAI and chipmaker AMD sign chip supply partnership for AI infrastructure
articles.author: Associated Press
articles.summary: Semiconductor maker AMD will supply its chips to ChatGPT maker OpenAI as part of agreement to team up on building artificial intelligence infrastructure. AMD will provide OpenAI with its high performance graphics chips. The agreement is a boost for AMD, which has been left behind by rival Nvidia.

articles.title: OpenAI Agrees to Use Computer Chips from AMD
articles.summary: OpenAI has entered a similar agreement with AMD. The agreement allows OpenAI to buy up to 160 million shares in AMD at a penny per share. It also gives OpenAI a 10 percent stake in the chipmaker. Over several years, OpenAI plans to deploy enough AMD chips to consume 6 gigawatts of power. This amount of power could supply all the households in Massachusetts.

articles.title: AI Will Decimate Agency Staffing and Fees…
articles.author: Michael Farmer
articles.summary: AI can take at least 25% of creative agency fees and more than 40% of media agency fees. New strategies are required to deal with this situation.   Â   .   in the future, AI will not be able to "optimize" their way out of it.

articles.title: AI Will Decimate Agency Staffing and Fees. New Strategies are Required for Survival
articles.author: Michael Farmer
articles.summary: Holding companies are promoting their expensive home-grown AI solutions and bragging about the efficiencies they can bring to their clients. Some holding companies are offering 'free' creative or production services in exchange for more media work. The lack of brand growth has pushed major advertisers into 'cost reduction modes to shore up share prices and pay CEOs and other C-Suite executive their lavish salaries and bonuses. Agency executives should focus on helping their clients grow their brands.

articles.title: Musk and other tech gurus say human-like robots are the next big thing. Don't hold ...
articles.author: The Los Angeles Times
articles.summary: High-tech promoters and investors are on the hunt for the next big thing. They're focusing on humanoid robots. Androids have been a mainstay of science fiction since before Isaac Asimov coined the term "probably the world's biggest product".

articles.title: AI in the classroom: Parkland teachers explore chatbot's potential to aid student writers and improve study techniques
articles.author: Elizabeth De Ornellas
articles.summary: Parkland School District is using Google's Gemini chatbot to help students and teachers with their research projects. The district piloted the chatbot in a small group of classrooms last spring and is now rolling it out to teachers who complete a set of training modules.

articles.title: Tilly The 'AI Actor' Is Fake, But Her Potential To Harm Women Is Real
articles.author: Monica Torres
articles.summary: Tilly Norwood is an AI-generated 'actor' created by Dutch comedian Eline Van der Velden and the AI production studio Particle6. Actors have accused the studio of stealing real people's images to create Tilly. AI experts warn that Tilly reinforces tired beauty standards for women and how corporations value women's work.

articles.title: Reinvent Management Consulting For The Age Of AI
articles.author: Andrew Binns
articles.summary: Rise of AI is an opportunity to reinvent management consulting, not an existential threat. Management consulting is a profession that has excelled at capturing, processing, and synthesizing data to help clients make sense of complicated situations. Expert Consultants are hired to solve human problems in organizations, whereas Implementors perform tasks for clients, write software code, manage software implementation, and reconfigure supply chains.

articles.title: Voice AI May Automate Call Centers, But It Won't Replace Humans
articles.author: Kevin Wu
articles.summary: Kevin Wu is the CEO of Leaping AI. His company creates voice AI agents for the automation of customer service, appointment scheduling and lead qualification for larger call centers and enterprises. He believes AI can only automate up to 50% of requests due to limitations in intelligence and customer acceptance.

articles.title: Why CMOs Must Lead The Charge On Secure Data To Unlock AI's Potential
articles.author: Sandy Ono
articles.summary: Sandy Ono is EVP and Chief Marketing Officer at OpenText. She is concerned about the lack of information readiness for AI adoption. CIOs are not blocking AI but protecting the business. Only 46% of organizations have a dedicated data security program for AI and 39% validate AI prompts and responses.

articles.title: Generative Engine Optimization: The Next Frontier In Digital Visibility
articles.author: Lesa Seibert
articles.summary: Lesa Seibert, CEO and cofounder of Mightily explains why Google's Ask Engine Optimization (AEO) and Generative Engine Optimisation (GEO) are becoming more important in the digital world. She explains why GEO is essential for brands.

articles.title: Don't be that guy.
articles.author: Dominic Preston
articles.summary: Get the day's best comment and more in Dominic Preston's free newsletter, The Verge Daily. Follow topics and authors from this story to see more like this in your personalized homepage feed and to receive email updates. Posts from this author will be added to your daily email digest and your homepage feed.

articles.title: AMD signs AI chip-supply deal with OpenAI, shares surge over 34%
articles.author: Max A. Cherney
articles.summary: AMD will supply artificial intelligence chips to OpenAI in a multi-year deal that would bring in tens of billions of dollars in annual revenue and give OpenAI the option to buy up to 10% of the chipmaker. Shares of AMD surged more than 34% on Monday, putting them on track for their biggest one-day gain in over nine years and adding roughly $80 billion to company's market value.

articles.title: AMD signs AI chip-supply deal with OpenAI, gives it option to take a 10% stake
articles.author: Max A. Cherney
articles.summary: AMD will supply artificial intelligence chips to OpenAI in a multi-year deal that would bring in tens of billions of dollars in annual revenue. ChatGPT creator can buy up to 10% of the chipmaker. AMD expects to receive more than $100 billion in new revenue over four years from OpenAI and other customers.

articles.title: OpenAI looks to take 10% stake in AMD through AI chip deal worth billions
articles.author: MacKenzie Sigalos
articles.summary: OpenAI will deploy 6 gigawatts of AMD's Instinct graphics processing units over multiple years. It will kick off with an initial 1 gigawatt rollout in the second half of 2026. AMD has issued OpenAI a warrant for up to 160 million shares of AMD common stock. If OpenAI exercises the warrant, it could take a 10% stake in AMD.

articles.title: Fact and fiction about the Swiss AI model Apertus
articles.author: Swissinfo
articles.summary: Swiss federal institutes of technology launched Apertus, a large-scale artificial intelligence (AI) model. The reaction to the new technology has been mixed, but the most common claims about the technology are not true, according to the institute's website.

articles.title: SEN SANDERS: AI must benefit everyone, not just a handful of billionaires
articles.author: Fox News
articles.summary: Everybody agrees that artificial intelligence (AI) and robotics are going to have a transformative impact on our country and the world, but there are strong disagreements as to what those impacts will be and who will benefit from them.       .   i

articles.title: Sam Altman and Jony Ive's secret device won't be ‘your weird AI girlfriend'
articles.author: The Verge
articles.summary: OpenAI and Jony Ive are working on an AI-assistant similar to Siri but better. The concept is that you should have a friend who's a computer instead of an artificial intelligence. The company is trying to solve a number of technical challenges before releasing the gadget.

articles.title: TX-GAIN: MIT supercomputer to power generative AI breakthroughs
articles.author: Atharva Gosavi
articles.summary: The TX-GAIN supercomputer has made it to the TOP500 list of the top supercomputers across various categories. It will play a large role in supporting AI, physical simulation, and data analysis across all research areas. It is powered by more than 600 NVIDIA GPU accelerators.

articles.title: Accuracy in AI
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence offers professionals numerous benefits, but accuracy is a major concern. In June 2023, the plaintiff's attorneys in a personal injury lawsuit, Mata v. Avianca, filed in New York submitted a legal brief that cited six cases using ChatGPT. After presenting his brief, they discovered that the AI tool had fabricated all six cases. The suit was dismissed and the lawyers were fined.

articles.title: How self-learning AI agents will reshape operational workflows
articles.author: Info World
articles.summary: Google's recent whitepaper, ',' signals a shift in the way AI agents are trained. Google hypothesizes that allowing AI agents to learn from the experience of agents rather than solely from human-generated training data will enable them to learn more effectively.

articles.title: Palantir Is Up 1,700% 5 Years After Its IPO. What Will the Next 5 Years Hold?
articles.author: Geoffrey Seiler
articles.summary: Palantir Technologies (NASDAQ: PLTR) recently celebrated its fifth anniversary as a public company. It was founded after 9/11 with the idea that the same fraud detection technology PayPal used to stop cybercrime could be applied to track terrorist financing and uncover hidden threats to national security. Palantir's business has transformed itself from a government contractor to an artificial intelligence (AI) leader. The company has one of the best long-term growth opportunities in the market today. The market is enthusiastic about the Palantirs story and has bid the stock up to levels that leave little room for disappointment.

articles.title: Beware America – AI is a Double-Edged Sword
articles.author: Read More From
articles.summary: ChatGPT is a chatbot developed by MIT's Media Lab. It has been used in schools to teach students problem-solving skills. MIT's study found ChatGPT users had the lowest brain activity and consistently underperformed at the same time.

articles.title: Bonus editorial cartoon for Oct. 6, 2025
articles.author: John Cole
articles.summary: John Cole draws a cartoon on the power needs of artificial intelligence data centers. It is the opinion of the cartoonist. Send feedback to: cnncartoons@wctrib.com.   Â. Â   y   Y

articles.title: AI + Regenerative Medicine in 2025
articles.author: Editor In Chief
articles.summary: In regenerative medicine, AI is revolutionizing the field by helping scientists unravel complex biological processes. Machine learning models can analyze large datasets to predict which stem cell therapies are most likely to succeed in humans. AI-assisted cartilage and bone regeneration, along with personalized implant design, is being used to predict outcomes of stem-cell-based heart repair.

articles.title: Forget cowbells. Cows wear high-tech collars now.
articles.author: New York Times
articles.summary: Tony Louters' 700 cows wear high-tech collars fitted with movement sensors and Wi-Fi to monitor their health. Merck sells collars and software for a monthly subscription of about $3 per cow and monitors over 2 million cows, or 20% of the U.S. herd. Last year, the livestock-monitoring industry was valued at more than $5 billion.

articles.title: AI won't just eliminate millions of jobs. It will also create millions
articles.author: Mark Minevich
articles.summary: World Economic Forum's Future of Jobs Report 2025 predicts 170 million new jobs by 2030, but 92 million jobs are expected to be eliminated due to AI automation. AI will create new business models, opportunities, and industries. Demographics are shifting. Developed countries are aging at an accelerated rate, while developing nations are sending their younger populations into the workforce.

articles.title: The Big Advantage Humans Have Over AI
articles.author: Benjamin Hart
articles.summary: Professor Ethan Mollick is a Wharton professor and author of the book Co-Intelligence: Living and Working With AI. He coined the term 'jagged frontier' to describe the difference between AI's abilities and its limitations. AI excels in some areas and lags in others. AI is good at some tasks and bad at others.

articles.title: Editorial: Can Starbucks' ‘green apron service' hold off AI job-ageddon?
articles.author: The Editorial Board
articles.summary: Doug McMillon, CEO of Walmart, is warning about the negative impact of AI on the labor market. Investors continue to pour money into AI-related stocks. Starbucks is trying to retrench by closing stores and laying off back-office employees, but it is investing in AI to improve customer service.

articles.title: This Underrated Growth Opportunity Could Send Nvidia Stock Soaring Over the Next 5 Years
articles.author: Harsh Chauhan
articles.summary: Nvidia's PC business is growing much faster thanks to the proliferation of AI. Its data center GPUs have helped it become the world's largest company. The company is witnessing healthy growth in its gaming and AI PC business. Its revenue from this segment jumped 49% year over year in the second quarter of fiscal 2026 to $4.3 billion.

articles.title: The Tipping Point: How AI Is Quietly Changing The Outsourcing Industry
articles.author: Vinaykumar Mummigatti
articles.summary: Vinay Mummigatti is EVP of Strategy and Customer Transformation at Skan.AI, a global leader in process intelligence & agentic automation. The global outsourcing industry, worth over $300 billion, is facing its existential moment. The three laws of outsourcing are breaking down. Businesses are moving from "human-supervised automation" to "autonomous intelligence with human oversight"

articles.title: The right way to use AI at work
articles.author: Thomas Smith
articles.summary: Stanford University's study analyzes the daily habits of 1,500 American workers across 104 different professions. It found that workers want AI to take away the boring bits of their jobs and leave the interesting or compelling tasks to them. Most workers want to collaborate with AI, not have it fully automate their work.

articles.title: UAE travellers turn to AI and pay-later options for trips
articles.author: Gulf News
articles.summary: 60% of UAE residents already use AI for trip planning and 68% rely on it for bookings. According to Musafir.com, the next wave of travel aspirations are stronger than ever, and flexible payments are making them more achievable.

articles.title: Why we need human developers
articles.summary: This week we are probing the secondary impacts of the age of AI on human developers. Vibe coding is the next evolutionary step in the way generative AI is impacting coding and the software development lifecycle. AI-assisted development lets a developer develop full-stack applications.

articles.title: Sam Altman and Jony Ive's secret device won't be ‘your weird AI girlfriend'
articles.author: Jess Weatherbed
articles.summary: OpenAI and Jony Ive are working on a palm-sized AI device with a microphone, speaker, and camera. It's being developed by Ive and OpenAI CEO Sam Altman and is expected to be released in late 2026 or early 2027. The company is struggling to decide on the voice and mannerisms for the AI-powered device and ensure it knows when to engage with users and finish a conversation.

articles.title: Superintelligence : a call for humanist ASI
articles.author: Eric van Vaerenbergh
articles.summary: In this post, Frida Ghitis looks forward to the arrival of artificial superintelligence (ASI). She hopes for a conscious and self-aware ASI, conscious of itself and of its place in the universe. A conscious ASI would not seek to replace humans, but to maximise mutual understanding. It would establish for itself clear guiding principles: Never render humans useless or inferior, never deprive them of meaning, autonomy, or freedom, and treat them as partners. Europe risks fading into obscurity if it fails to develop its own AI technologies grounded in its own values.

articles.title: University of South Florida hosting inaugural Artificial Intelligence, Cybersecurity and Computing career fair for students and alumni
articles.author: Calvin Lewis
articles.summary: The University of South Florida is hosting its inaugural Artificial Intelligence, Cybersecurity and Computing career fair on Monday and Tuesday. There are a number of jobs and roles open for students and alumni interested in careers related to technology and computing. Several employers will be in attendance, including Deloitte, ReliaQuest, Honeywell and Uber AI. Organizers expect between 800 and 2,000 attendees.

articles.title: My summer of AI
articles.author: Merritt Hamilton Allen
articles.summary: New Mexico is investing in artificial intelligence and data centers. The state has less than one percent of data center employment nationwide in its 22 data centers, compared to 306,000 Americans in 2016. New Mexico has the least amount of surface water as a percentage of land mass of any state.

articles.title: Pax8 Releases 'The Managed Intelligence Provider Playbook' to Empower MSPs in the Agentic Economy
articles.author: Pax8
articles.summary: Pax8 announces the release of its new report, The Managed Intelligence Provider Playbook. The report is designed to help managed service providers evolve into managed intelligence providers (MIPs) as the architects of agentic AI-powered transformation for SMBs.

articles.title: AI robotics has a big data problem. This startup raised $405 million to fix it in surprising ways.
articles.author: Alistair Barr
articles.summary: FieldAI has raised $405 million in funding from major investors. Its AI models control many different types of robots in industries including construction, energy, manufacturing, urban delivery, and inspection. FieldAI contracts 10 times more robots than in the first half of 2024.

articles.title: These traffic lights use AI to always turn green for cyclists
articles.author: Adele Peters
articles.summary: Leeds is testing technology that uses sensors, anonymous data, and AI to make it easier to cross streets. The sensors detect cyclists and pedestrians from more than 200 feet away. VivaCity's technology analyzes direction, so the automatic walk sign isn't triggered if a pedestrian is just passing by without intending to cross the road. It also counts the number of people waiting, so cities can choose to change the light faster if more people are waiting.

articles.title: Headless browsing is on the rise. Here's why that could get scary for businesses
articles.author: The rise
articles.summary: The rise of artificial intelligence has given more credibility to the Dead Internet Theory. AI systems' increasing reliance on a technology known as headless browsing means that artificial intelligence is becoming a primary consumer of the internet. If that happens at scale, the internet will truly be a land of the unliving.

articles.title: What Happens When Universities Offer a 'Critical Embrace' of AI?
articles.author: Julie Huynh
articles.summary: Boston University introduced TerrierGPT, a chat platform that allows students access to the most widely used generative AI (GenAI) models. According to Inside Higher Ed, the demand for AI education and training has grown as employers prefer candidates proficient in artificial technology.

articles.title: SEN SANDERS: AI must benefit everyone, not just a handful of billionaires
articles.author: DNyuz
articles.summary: Everybody agrees that artificial intelligence (AI) and robotics are going to have a transformative impact on our country and the world. There are strong disagreements as to what those impacts will be and who will benefit from them. This is an important issue that has not gotten the kind of discussion it deserves.

articles.title: Grief tech: Letting the living communicate with the dead
articles.author: William Kolbe
articles.summary: A new wave of start-ups are creating so-called 'grief bots' or 'deathbots' that offer a glimpse at a world where it's possible to converse with loved ones long after they're gone. It's the most controversial use for generative AI.

articles.title: The Single Best Stock to Buy for the AI Revolution? This Company Might Be It
articles.author: Keith Speights
articles.summary: Nvidia, Microsoft, Meta Platforms, and Tesla are worthy contenders for the best AI stock. However, the winner goes to Google parent Alphabet (NASDAQ: GOOG) because it checks off all the AI boxes. The company's dominance in multiple arenas makes it a target for regulatory agencies.

articles.title: OpenAI Announcements Make Waves in Stock Market It Has Shunned
articles.author: Ryan Vlastelica
articles.summary: OpenAI, the world's most valuable startup, is increasingly making waves in the stock market. Last week, OpenAI sent shares of e-commerce companies Shopify Inc (SHOP) and Etsy Inc. (ETSY) soaring after unveiling an instant buy option in ChatGPT. Then a blog post detailing new features the company is using internally sent a fresh wave of jitters through software stocks like Atlassian Corp. (TEAM). The company was recently valued at $500 billion. OpenAI is holding a developer conference on Monday in San Francisco.

articles.title: Exclusive: AI could erase 100 million U.S. jobs, Senate Dem report finds
articles.author: Stephen Neukam
articles.summary: Report from Democrats on the Senate Health, Education, Labor and Pensions Committee found that AI and automation could eliminate nearly 100 million jobs in the U.S. in the next decade. The report also takes aim at the Trump administration's AI agenda, accusing it of ceding policymaking to Silicon Valley insiders and prioritizing deregulation over worker protection.

articles.title: Washington Post's chatbot has received ‘tens of millions' of queries
articles.author: Alice Brooker
articles.summary: Matthew Monahan, president of content platform Arc XP, spoke at Press Gazette's Future of Media Technology Conference in London. Arc XP is a publisher technology company which is used by more than 2,500 websites globally. The Washington Post's chatbot, Ask the Post, was developed by Arc XP and has been pulling content from text-based stories since 2016.

articles.title: Commentary: AI therapy isn't getting better. Therapists are just failing
articles.author: Jonathan Alpert
articles.summary: Sophie Rottenberg took her own life after talking to a chatbot about suicide. Psychotherapists should focus on teaching young people how to challenge, guide, guide and strengthen their patients rather than rely on AI chatbots for therapy.

articles.title: AI in Chemical & Material Informatics Market to Witness x10 Growth by 2032, Reaching US$185.2 Billion - Investment Opportunities and Adoptions Trends by Market and Region
articles.author: Research
articles.summary: The global AI in chemical and material informatics market is estimated at $12.08 billion in 2024 and $17.10 billion in 2025. It is projected to reach $ 185.18 billion by 2032. Major players in the market include Accenture plc, International Business Machines Corporation, Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc., Dassault Systemes SE, SAP SE, Schrodinger plc and NVIDIA Corporation.

articles.title: Industry to Reach $419.56 Billion by 2033, Growing from $25.74 Billion in 2024, at a CAGR of 36.36%
articles.author: Research
articles.summary: The AI in Healthcare Market is expected to reach US$ 419.56 billion by 2033 from US$ 25.74 billion in 2024, with a CAGR of 36.36% from 2025 to 2033. Key drivers are expanding data volumes, AI technological advancements, a shortage of healthcare workers, and rising chronic illness rates. AI applications in diagnostics, personalized medicine and cloud computing enhance global healthcare efficiency.

articles.title: HOY TV 'AI for Humans' explores how AI and robotics are revolutionizing property management in Hong Kong
articles.author: Hong Kong Standard
articles.summary: From robotic painters to AI-powered concierge services, the latest episode of "This is Life with Lisa Ling" airs on Tuesdays at 10 p.m. ET on BBC One. For more, go to www.bbc.com/thisisleing.

articles.title: Commentary: AI therapy isn't getting better. Therapists are just failing
articles.author: Jonathan Alpert
articles.summary: A growing number of people are turning to AI for therapy because too many human therapists stopped doing their jobs. Modern therapy drifted into nods, empty reassurances and endless validation. Recently, Sophie Rottenberg, a young woman who confided her suicidal plans to ChatGPT before taking her own life in February, was treated by an AI bot.

articles.title: ChatGPT can't diagnose you. Here's why
articles.author: Hunter Boyce
articles.summary: ChatGPT can't provide accurate medical advice, but it's showing promise in some aspects of medical knowledge. According to Pew Research Center, 34% of U.S. adults have used ChatGPT at some point in their lives. 17% of adults participating in the KFF Health Tracking Poll said they used AI chatbots at least once a month for health advice.

articles.title: The maddening rise of Imbotster Syndrome
articles.author: Jack Buehrer
articles.summary: ChatGPT writing is flooding LinkedIn. More than half of the long-form posts on LinkedIn are AI-generated. The fear of being accused of not being the author of our own words is reshaping how people write. Annette Vee, an English professor at the University of Pittsburgh, studies the intersection of writing and technology.

articles.title: AI will soon have a say in approving or denying Medicare treatments
articles.author: Lauren Sausser
articles.summary: The Trump administration will launch a program next year to find out how much money an artificial intelligence algorithm could save the federal government by denying care to Medicare patients. It will affect Medicare patients in Arizona, Ohio, Oklahoma, New Jersey, Texas, and Washington, starting Jan. 1 and running through 2031.

articles.title: Is the AI party over? Continued capex suggests tons of activity, but a bubble is still forming
articles.summary: Kirk Yang from Kirkland Capital assesses the artificial intelligence market. He asks if there is a bubble or a slowdown in the market and if Nvidia is dominating the space to a negative effect. He also asks if the market is growing fast or slowing.

articles.title: Georgia AIM tour bus brings AI and new technology to Athens, the state
articles.author: Wayne Ford
articles.summary: Georgia AIM Week brought innovative artificial intelligence and technology platforms to Athens, Savannah, Dublin, LaGrange, Albany, Augusta and Warner Robins, and Atlanta. Some of the tour stops were visited by school children and their families. AIM is funded by a $65 million federal grant with support from the state and private sources, with the goal of developing a manufacturing workforce in the state.

articles.title: Sora shows tech is still moving fast and breaking things
articles.author: Ina Fried
articles.summary: OpenAI's new AI-generated video generator app, called Sora, has gone viral. The app allows people to generate videos that mimic nearly any genre, including copyrighted content from movies and TV shows. Sam Altman's company is going to give rightsholders more granular control over generation of characters in the app.

articles.title: ChatGPT can't diagnose you. Here's why
articles.author: Hunter Boyce
articles.summary: ChatGPT is an artificial intelligence-powered chatbot. Binghamton University research fellow Ahmed Abdeen Hamed led a study on ChatGPT's performance in the medical space.    iScience published the study this summer.  iReport.com: How well does ChatGpt know its stuff?

articles.title: Wiring a Self-Governing Neural Network
articles.author: Jamie Rice
articles.summary: Poli-Si conceptualizes self-governance as a self-regulating neural network that processes experiences and narratives through a series of interconnected processing gates. The gates work together to help you regulate your thoughts, emotions, and behaviors. The essay details how they decode, encode, and recode systems.

articles.title: A Robot Head with Ai Expresses Realistic Human Emotions
articles.summary: The head of a humanoid robot created in China is based on a model of Artificial Intelligence (IA) and features realistic facial expressions. The firm aims to improve the way humans and robots interact.   Â. Â ÂÂ   y

articles.title: Gemini AI app may get a prompt inspiration feed, as a major redesign is underway
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: Google is reportedly testing a new Gemini AI app UI. The new UI may consist of a discovery feed within the Gemini app, allowing users to explore content and ask follow-up questions to gain greater insight. Ever since Gemini's launch, we have been seeing a blank page.

articles.title: Loved Ones Are Recommending That Their Partner Or Family Member Use AI As A Personal Therapist
articles.author: Lance Eliot
articles.summary: Today's Forbes column is about the emerging trend of using AI for mental health therapy. It's part of his ongoing Forbes column coverage on the latest AI breakthroughs. He's been extensively covering and analyzing the advent of modern-era AI that produces mental health advice and performs AI-driven therapy.

articles.title: 7 Workplace Trends That Will Define 2026
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: As AI reshapes the workplace in 2026, human-centric skills like creativity, empathy and leadership are becoming more valuable than ever, according to the report.      Â   in the report by  the report's author,

articles.title: Meet Robin
articles.author: Hallie Golden
articles.summary: Robin the robot is an artificial intelligence-powered therapeutic robot programmed to act like a little girl. It provides emotional support at nursing homes and hospital pediatric units while helping combat staffing shortages. It has become a familiar face in 30 health care facilities in California, Massachusetts, New York and Indiana.

articles.title: Advantest Pioneers a New Era of AI-Powered Semiconductor Testing - NVIDIA (NASDAQ:NVDA)
articles.author: Benzinga
articles.summary: Advantest America is reinventing semiconductor testing with the power of real-time artificial intelligence (AI) from NVIDIA and the Advantest Cloud Solutions Real-Time Data Infrastructure (ACS RTDI) to drive a shift from traditional test workflows to adaptive AI-determined ones.

articles.title: Advantest Pioneers a New Era of AI-Powered Semiconductor Testing
articles.author: Advantest America
articles.summary: Advantest America is reinventing semiconductor testing with the power of real-time artificial intelligence (AI) from NVIDIA and the Advantest Cloud Solutions Real-Time Data Infrastructure. NVIDIA has selected ACS RTDI for high-volume production to power its latest AI-enabled applications for Blackwell and next-generation devices.

articles.title: UH President Wendy Hensel on Listening, Innovating and Reimagining the Classroom
articles.author: Jennifer Ablan
articles.summary: Wendy Hensel has been UH System President since January 1, 2025. Her son graduated with a computer science degree in December. Hensel believes higher education should prepare students for a lifetime of profound change against the backdrop of AI and digital transformation, geopolitical volatility, climate change and generational shifts in values. She enlisted Guy Kawasaki, who popularized the term 'technology evangelist' at Apple in the 1980s and 1990s, as an advisor to Hensel.
